credit: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard F. Walker in memory of Jacob and Rosalie Siegel
provenance: Myron BarlowJacob and Rosalie Siegel (purchased directly from the artist on 22 March 1919). Sold to Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Walker, 1975. DIA in 1975

title: Indian Summer
name: Jervis McEntee
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Gibbs-Williams Fund and Dexter M. Ferry, Jr. Fund
provenance: James W.  Pinchot, New York and Washington, D.C., ca. 1862-66 until 1908.Governor Gifford Pinchot.Mr. Gifford Pinchot, until 1975.Hirschl & Adler Galleries, New York.Acquired in 1975.

title: Still Life with Yellow Apples
name: John F. Francis
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Gibbs-Williams Fund
provenance: Vose Galleries, BostonAcquired in 1975.

title: COTOPAXI
name: Frederic Edwin Church
credit: Founders Society  Purchase, Robert H. Tannahill Foundation Fund, Gibbs-Williams Fund, Dexter M. Ferry Jr. Fund, Merrill Fund, Beatrice W. Rogers Fund, and Richard A. Manoogian Fund
provenance: James Lenox (It was commissioned by him),  New York, 1862-80.  Lenox Library (later New York Public Library), New York, 1880-1945. M. Knoedler and Co., New York, 1945 John Astor, Miami, Florida (He was a descendent of Lenox),  New York, 1945-76.Hirschl & Adler Galleries, New York, 1976.DIA in 1976.

title: King Lear
name: Benjamin West
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Gibbs-Williams Fund
provenance: Formerly in the collection of: William Beckford, Bath, by 1838; his daughter Euphemia, wife of the tenth Duke ofHamilton; the twelfth Duke of Hamilton.  Hamilton Palace sale, Christies, London, June 17-July 20, 1882, lot 1068.H. Graves and Co. (dealers), London.Thomas B. Walker, Minneapolis, 1909.Harry W. Peterson, 1937.Frank Gunter, Champaign, Illinois, 1977.Acquired in 1977.

title: Forest Scene in the Catskills
name: Asher Brown Durand
credit: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Harold O. Love
provenance: Kennedy Galleries, New York, 1960Harold O. Love, Grosse Pointe Woods, MichiganAcquired in 1977

title: Indian Summer
name: Jasper Francis Cropsey
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Robert H. Tannahill Foundation Fund, James and Florence Beresford Fund, Gibbs-Williams Fund and Beatrice W. Rogers Fund
provenance: H.  H.  Leeds and Miner,  and H. W. Derby, 1867.Frank Johnston Jones. University of Cincinnati, Ohio, 1928-77.Hirschl & Adler, New  York.DIA in 1978.

title: Death on the Pale Horse
name: Benjamin West
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Robert H. Tannahill Foundation Fund
provenance: Formerly in the collection of: Possibly  Henry Thomson, R. A., London.George Wyndham, third Earl of Egremont, Petworth House, Sussex, by 1820;John Wyndham, seventh Baron Leconfield and second Baron Egremont.Wyndham sale, Sotheby's, London, July 19, 1978, lot 18.P. and D. Colnaghi (dealer), London.Acquired in 1979.

title: The Last Supper
name: Benjamin West
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Robert H. Tannahill Foundation Fund and Gibbs-Williams Fund
provenance: Commissioned by George III and presented by him in 1786 to Saint George's Chapel, Windsor.Sale, Dean and Canons of Windsor, Sotheby's, London, June 2, 1978, lot 132.Somerville and Simpson (dealer), London, and P. and D. Colnaghi (dealer), London.Acquired in 1980.

title: Panel for Music Room
name: John White Alexander
credit: Founders Society Purchase, Beatrice W. Rogers Fund, Dexter M. Ferry, Jr. Fund, Merrill Fund, and Eleanor and Edsel Ford Exhibition and Acquisition Fund
provenance: Mrs. John White AlexanderIrina A. Reed, New York (grandaughter of John White Alexander)Graham Galleries, New YorkDIA in 1982

title: READING THE STORY OF OENONE
name: Francis Davis Millet
credit: Detroit Museum of Art Purchase, Art Loan Fund and Popular Subscription Fund
provenance: Acquired in 1883.

title: The Court of Death
name: Rembrandt Peale
credit: Gift of George H. Scripps
provenance: Formerly in the collection of:G. Q. Cotton, Philadelphia, 1858S. A. Coale (dealer), St. Louis, 1885George H. Scripps, Detroit, 1885.Acquired in 1885.

title: THE MISSING VESSEL
name: Frank Knox Morton Rehn
credit: Detroit Museum of Art Purchase, Merrill Hall Exhibition Proceeds
provenance: DMA purchase from artist, from Merrill Hall Exhibition proceeds.

title: A Surprise Party
name: John George Brown
credit: Detroit Museum of Art Purchase
provenance: DIA in 1888.

title: The Young Artist
name: Ellen Kendall Baker
dimensions: Canvas: 28 x 23 in. (71.1 x 58.4 cm)Framed: 40 x 35 1/8 x 4 1/2 in.
credit: Gift of the Friends of the Museum
provenance: Purchased by subscription through the efforts of Mrs. E. C. Skinner and Mrs. H. P. Jenkins and presented to the museum. Purchased from the artist.

title: The Lily Pond
name: Charles Harry Eaton
credit: Detroit Museum of Art Purchase, Popular Subscription Fund
provenance: The artist to DIA, 1889.  File says that the painting was "to be taken from Mr. Brearley," so he apparently purchased it for the museum and was later reimbursed. Purchased from artist.

title: Queen Philippa Interceding for the Lives of the Burghers of Calais
name: Benjamin West
credit: Gift of James E. Scripps
provenance: Thomas Hankey sale, Christie's, London, June 7-8, 1799, lot 20.John Willett sale, Peter Coxe, London, June 1, 1813, lot 79.James E. Scripps, Detroit.Acquired in 1889.

title: Vespers
name: Gari Melchers
dimensions: Canvas: 38 x 28 in.  (96.5 x 71.1 cm)Framed: 51 1/2 x 41 3/4 x 5 in.
credit: Gift of the Witenagemote Club
provenance: Witenagemote Club, purchased in 1889 as a giftDIA in 1889..

title: Evangeline Discovering her Affianced in the Hospital
name: Samuel Richards
credit: Gift of Mr. Bela Hubbard
provenance: Samuel Richards (the artist)Bela Hubbard (purchased it for $3,000)DMA in 1892.

title: Portrait of Mr. William H. Brearly
name: Lewis Thomas Ives
credit: Gift of Mrs. William H. Brearley
provenance: By descent to the sitter's wife.Acquired in 1896

title: Lady in Pink
name: Joseph W. Gies
credit: Detroit Museum of Art Purchase, Artists' Fund
provenance: Purchased directly from the artist and was the first purchase made by the DMA Artists' Fund. Painting had been part of the "Third Annual Exhibition of the Society of Western Artists."

title: THE WATER CARRIERS
name: Daniel Ridgway Knight
medium: Oil on canvas mounted on board
credit: Gift of the C. J. Glasgow Company
provenance: C.J. Glascow Company, Detroit.  Acquired as a gift in 1968.

title: Mrs. John J. Bagley
name: Lewis Thomas Ives
credit: Gift of James K. Watkins, Jr., George H. Watkins, John B. Watkins and Margaret H. Watkins in memory of Mrs. James K. Watkins
provenance: The sitter's son John Newbury Bagley.  His daughterFrances Bagley Wallace.  Mrs. James K. Watkins.Acquired in 1977.
